questions.question:
A user is notified their software install has been flagged for reclamation. The user declines approval.
What is the next step in the workflow?
answers: B. The user’s manager must approve or decline the reclamation.
C. The reclamation candidate is removed from the candidate list.
D. The software is reclaimed since it was not in use the notification was only informational.
E. A justification is requested and submitted to Change Management for approval.

comments.content:
The answer is B -the user's manager must review and approve or deny reclamation.
as per page 420 in the SAM book from the SAM course

questions.question: What does a usage record track?
answers: A. The sum of usage for a selected data
B. The high watermark of software usage
C. The sum of usage on a weekly basis
D. The sum of usage since installation date
E. The sum of usage on a monthly basis

comments.content: E - per the SAM Book A Software Usage Record tracks the sum of usage on a monthly basis.

The answer is E - a usage record tracks the sum of software usage on a monthly basis
This is from page 393 in the SAM book from the SAM course.
replies:
Isn't this just for Microsoft SCCM, though? https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sccm-software-usage.html

I am thinking it's A based on: Total Usage Time (default) as found here: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_AddAReclamationRule.html

A Usage Record is not specific to any one Publisher or product, it can be applied for multiple, so I believe this is answer A as it's more generic.

questions.question: Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Classification phase determines what?
answers: A. Are you there? How will I classify you?
B. Have I seen you before?
C. How should I classify you specifically?
D. What else can you tell me about yourself?

comments.content: Definitely C.

questions.question: When loading a large amount of software installation data, which is the best method to use?
answers: C. Manually add through ServiceNow forms

comments.content: Answer is A.  Large amounts of data - use Discovery, Medium - use import, small - use manual
Large amounts of data - use Discovery,  Medium - use import, small - use manual
A is correct

questions.question: The Per Named User license metric licenses which of the following?
answers: A. A user for a number of installations of software
B. A device for a number of installations of software
C. A specific user for a number of installations of software
D. Cores on a physical server or virtual machine
E. A specific device for a number of installations of software

comments.content: Answer is C - Per Named User - Licenses a specific user for a number of installations of software.

questions.question: What type of record is only created when a software model or entitlement exists for the product?

comments.content: From SAM on-demand course: "A software model results record is only created when a software model or entitlement exists for the product."

questions.question: Which of the following are tiers of software reconciliation results? (Choose two.)

comments.content: Correct answer is definitely D and E
Should be D E: Software model, Software Product, Software Pulisher, License Metric
Correct Answer D, E
Correct Answer D, E - Sam pro - 241
Correct Answer D, E.   The 4 tiers of Reconciliation Results are Software Publisher Results, Software Product Results, Software Model Results , License Metric Results.  Page 242 - SAM Book.

questions.question: Baseline license metrics are defined for which of the following? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
Out of all available records from 'samp_sw_license_metric' where Metric Group is "Common" (full list below), it's definitely A-D-F.

Device CAL
Per Core
Per Device
Per Named Device
Per Named User
Per Processor
Per User
Resource Consumption
User CAL
User/Device CAL
ADF - correct!  User, Device, Processor, and Core are the 4 baseline license metrics.  Pg 200 SAM Book.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid Remediation Options on the License Workbench after reconciliation has been run? (Choose three.)

comments.content: Answer BCD
B,C,D  - per SAM Book page 370.  Software Remediation includes:  Purchase Rights, Remove Allocations, Create Allocations, Remove Unallocated Installs, Remove Unlicensed Installs.

questions.question: Which of the following are valid States of Remediation Options on the License Workbench after reconciliation has been run? (Choose three.)

comments.content: A, B, E - per SAM Book pg 371 - Remediation Options Status includes: New, Complete, In Progress, and Void.

questions.question: What are Restricted software installations?
answers: A. Software installations that are unlicensed and unallocated
B. Software installations with low usage
C. Software installations with no usage
D. Software installations that are not normalized
E. Software installations that are unauthorized for use

comments.content: E. Software installations that are unauthorized for use
E - per SAM book page 421

questions.question: Once you are ready to retire software in ServiceNow, what is the critical first step in the retirement process?
answers: A. Notify users of the software retirement
B. Expire any active software entitlements
C. Uninstall all instances of the software

comments.content: B is correct.

B Correct Answer -  pg 240 SAM Book - Before you retire the first step is to remediate the reconciliation results to ensure you remain compliant.  You want to choose remove unlicensed installs option to identify the allocation and unlicensed installs to retire all the software entitlements.

questions.question: After importing your entitlements via the template where would you navigate to address any entitlement import errors?
answers: A. System Import Sets > Load Data > Entitlement Import Errors
B. Software Asset > Licensing > Import Entitlements
C. Software Asset > Administration > Job Results
D. Software Asset > Licensing > Entitlement import Errors

comments.content: It is D. However, this will only be applicable with the classic SAM; other valid option would be the Software Asset Workspace > License Usage > Entitlement import errors.

Errors in data streams exist and are not uncommon. By using the Import Entitlement capability, a number of exceptions are caught and presented to the SAM Pro user
in the Entitlement Import Errors table in the Licensing module.

questions.question: Which are valid States of Remediation Options on the Software Asset Workspace License usage view after reconciliation has been run? (Choose three.)

comments.content:
sys_choice.list  -  for table "amp_remediation_option"  element "status" has following choices:
- new
- completed
- void
- in_progress
- completed_with_errors
ADE is correct.
I thnk correct answer is A, D, E

questions.question: Which tab of the License usage view is used to reclaim software licenses that are not being used?

B. Software Asset Workspace Software asset analytics view

questions.question: By default, which persona is responsible for ensuring that the SAM program is rolled out and executed correctly and consistently across the organization?

comments.content:
From SAM on-deman course:

"SAM Process Owner: A senior manager with the influence and authority to ensure that the SAM process is rolled out and executed correctly and consistently across the organization."

questions.question: Which role is required to create custom license metrics?

comments.content: C - as per ServiceNow SAM course, the sam_admin role is required to read the custom metric script. The sam_developer role is required to create or modify a custom metric script

Creating the custom license metric is with the Sam_admin.
Scripting the custom license metric is with the sam_developer.
its A Sam admin since the creation of license metrics specifically falls under sam admin

questions.question: When importing and/or manually entering software entitlement data into SAM you find that you do not have the Publisher Part Number (PPN) for several of your entitlements. What essential information is required in order for you to successfully add these entitlement records?
answers: A. Agreement type, Purchased rights, Product, Asset tag, and Vendor
B. Publisher, Product, Version, Edition, Platform, and Language
C. Publisher, Product, License type, Purchased rights, Metric group, and License metric
D. Version, Edition, Platform, Purchased rights, Vendor, and Contract number

comments.content:
Hint:
alm_license  - does not offer "version" and/or "edition"  -  exclude answer B & D
alm_license - does not offer "vendor"                               - exclude answer A
alm_license - does not offer  "product"                             - exclude answer  B & C

questions.question: When using the ServiceNow Client Software Distribution (CSD) product in conjunction with Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) to automatically remove software and reclaim license rights in your environment which of the following is required?
answers: A. The software to be removed must have been installed by SCCM
B. You must purchase Orchestration separately in order to revoke software and reclaim license rights using SAM Pro
C. The software to be removed must have been discovered by SCCM
D. An SCCM configuration record must be created to identify the application and the associated software discovery mode

comments.content:
D is correct.

Excerpt from SAM on-Demand course: "To utilize the revoke and reclaim capability, an SCCM configuration record must be created that identifies the application, the uninstall collection for the application, and the associated software discovery model. An uninstall collection must be identified to define a lease end date for deployed software, allow lease extensions, and revoke software from a user's machine."
The correct answer is D

questions.question: What SAM feature automatically adds the next version and downgrade rights to a software model?

comments.content:
Should be A
As per downgrade rights documentation from ServiceNow - The Software Asset Management content service generates downgrade rights. The downgrade rights correspond to a discovery map. A scheduled job, Download software content: Downgrade Rights triggered on a weekly basis, gets the downgrade rights from the Software Asset Management content service and pushes the data to the Downgrade Rights [samp_dmap_downgrade_model] table.
Same here - would like to change to A

B is correct answer.
The Software edition feature automatically manages version rights by:
Adding next version rights (upgrade rights)
Adding downgrade rights
These rights are automatically associated with the software model when the edition is configured
replies:
I would like to change my answer to A. Content Service.
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/downgrade-rights.html

comments.content:
Should be C in my view.
Downgrade Rights are associated to entitlements

questions.question: License Change Projection works for which of the following change types? (Choose two.)

comments.content: should be normal & emergency.
By the learning script it would be normal and emergency.

questions.question: What is the definition of Partially Normalized?
answers: A. A discovery model was normalized based on publisher product version fields
B. A discovery model was normalized based on publisher field a one
C. A discovery model was normalized based on publisher and product fields only
D. The software discovery model has not yet competed its run through the normalization process
E. A discovery model normalized based on product field alone

comments.content: A discovery model is partially normalized based on publisher and product fields only. In this case, the version field is editable and once that information is added the normalization status is changed to Manually Normalized. https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/normalization-status.html

questions.question: What are Microsoft Office 365 reserved licenses used tor?
answers: A. To reserve a block of licenses for a specific group of users and/or user role(s)
B. To convert subscription licenses to regular per device licenses
C. To accurately calculate annual true-up cost and total spend on a product
D. To convert regular per user licenses into subscription licenses

comments.content:
It's C 
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/create-o365-reserve.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com

From SAM on-Demand course: 

"Manage Microsoft Office 365 reserved licenses to accurately calculate annual true-up cost.  

Create reserve entitlements from existing Microsoft Office 365 subscription entitlements to add licenses to your subscription. The total cost of the reserved entitlement is included in the calculations for true-up cost and total spend on the product. 

Pay for the new licenses during your true-up process; after true-up, the reserved licenses are automatically converted into regular licenses. "

questions.question: Which SAM role grants a user the ability to set reclamation rules?

comments.content: A is correct. https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/task/t_AddAReclamationRule.html

questions.question: To accurately report your true up costs during reconciliation, what must you update In your software models? (Choose two.)
answers: C. License cost plus reserve license cost
E. License cost plus maintenance cost plus reserved license cost

comments.content:
Answer A and D are correct : 
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/yokohama-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/software-model-fields.html?utm_source=chatgpt.com
In question 193 about Office 365 reserved licenses are used for calculate true-up cost and total spend.. so maybe A & E should be proper answer :)
Answer: A and D
replies:
A & D, excerpt from SAM on-Demand course:

"To accurately report your software true-up cost during reconciliation, update your software models with the license cost or the license plus maintenance cost specified on your contract. Use these costs to calculate and report the true-up cost. 

If you do not specify a license cost or a license plus maintenance cost, the average software entitlement cost is used for true-up cost calculations."

comments.content: I think A and D is the correct answer.

License metric and License type from PPM. Additionally, you get Software model and Metric group.

B. Vendor Catalog item

Answer: B?

questions.question: During the normalization process a discovery model can be fully normalized based on which of these fields? (Choose three.)

comments.content: A, C, F is correct

A discovery model is fully normalized based on publisher, product, version fields. No fields are editable.
https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/reference/normalization-status.html

questions.question: Within ServiceNow Discovery, the Identification phase determines what?
answers: A. Have I seen you before?
B. How should I classify you specifically?
C. What else can you tell me about yourself?
D. Are you there? How will I classify you?

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. Have I seen you before?
During the Identification phase in ServiceNow Discovery, the system determines whether the discovered device or CI (Configuration Item) already exists in the Configuration Management Database (CMDB). It compares the discovered attributes against existing records to avoid duplicate entries and ensure accurate asset tracking.

Identification: After classification, the police check their records to see if the suspect has a criminal history. They ask, “Have we seen you before?” ...https://www.servicenow.com/community/itom-articles/servicenow-discovery-4-phase-process-pcie-through-a-simple-crime/ta-p/3091330

questions.question: What is unmanaged spend when viewing the Software Spend Detection Overview dashboard?
answers: A. The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product
B. The total spend for transactions where the publisher, product, and software model are identified but there's no software installations identified for the product
C. The total spend for transactions that are not identified as an accounts payable spend or an expense spend
D. The total spend for transactions that are identified for an unmanaged publisher

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. The total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model identified for the product.
Unmanaged spend refers to software expenses where the relevant publisher and product are known, but no corresponding software model has been established within the system. This represents a potential compliance risk and indicates areas where further management and oversight are needed to align spending with organizational policies

Total spend for transactions where the publisher and product are identified but there's no software model for the product... https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/software-spend-detection-overview-dashboard.html

questions.question: What is required to manage utilization of the Software Asset Management Content Service?
answers: A. The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of n the future if required
B. The service is automatically enabled through the baseline installation but can be opted out of if required
C. A script must be defied to identify what information should be shared with the Content Service
D. Nothing. The service is automatically enabled and cannot be opted out of
E. The service must be opted in to but, once enabled, it cannot be opted out of

comments.content:
The correct answer is:

A. The service must be opted in to and can be opted out of in the future if required
The Software Asset Management (SAM) Content Service requires organizations to opt in to leverage its features, such as receiving updated software recognition rules and normalization content. If necessary, organizations can later opt out to discontinue participation without affecting their core SAM operations.
A is correct. https://www.servicenow.com/docs/bundle/xanadu-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/c_SAMContentService.html
